info.title: Zoom Events API
info.description: Zoom Events API enables seamless integration, granting developers access to Zoom's data. Empower your apps with private services or public offerings on the [Zoom App Marketplace](https://marketplace.zoom.us/). Dive into [OAuth documentation](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/zoom-rooms/oauth/) for credential acquisition and app creation.

get.description:
Retrieves the attendee actions performed by host for an event.

**Scopes:** `zoom_events_attendee_actions:read`,`zoom_events_attendee_actions:read:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `zoom_events:read:list_attendee_actions`,`zoom_events:read:list_attendee_actions:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a set of large results. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned in a single API call. Max 300.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`    Attendee check-in Information.

total_records.description: The total number of records in the response.

email.description: The email address of the checked-in attendee.

source.description: The source of the action. Any information that can be used for tracking the source of this action.

items.description: The attendee and the action performed.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `2002`
Event not found.

patch.description:
Retrieves attendee onsite action for an event. You can perform actions such as onsite check-in for a single attendee or up to 300 attendees in a batch operation. In the case of a batch operation, the API response can be partial success.  Any errors are returned in the **errors** object.

**Scopes:** `zoom_events_attendee_actions:write`,`zoom_events_attendee_actions:write:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `zoom_events:update:batch_attendee_actions`,`zoom_events:update:batch_attendee_actions:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

email.description: The email address of the attendee.

items.description: The attendee and the action performed.

source.description: The source of the action. Any information that can be used for tracking the source of this action.

email.description: The email address of the failed checked-in attendee.

message.example: User doesn't have an on-site ticket

items.description: The list of check-in failures.

get.description:
Retrieves the list of co-editors and their edit permissions for an event.   Co-editors can make changes to the event details. Co-editors have view permission to all sections of the event.

**Scopes:** `zoom_events_coeditors:read`,`zoom_events_coeditors:read:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `zoom_events:read:list_coeditors`,`zoom_events:read:list_coeditors:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
 List of co-editors returned.

total_records.description: The total number of records in the response.

email.description: The co-editor's email address.

items.description:
The permissions given for the co-editor to edit particular sections of the event: 
 * `Publish` Event publish access 
 * `EventConfiguration` Event Configuration page 
 * `EventBranding` Event Branding page 
 * `Registration & Join` Registration & Join page 
 * `Venue` Event Experience page 
 * `EventExperience` Event Experience page 
 * `EventPlanning` Event Content page 
 * `SpecialRole` Special Roles page 
 * `PostEvent` Post Event page 
 * `Analytics` Analytics page 
 * `Email` Communications page 
 * `Integrations` Integrations page

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `2002`
Event not found.

get.description:
Retrieves a list of all the event's access links associated with the event.

**Scopes:** `zoom_events_access_links:read:admin`,`zoom_events_access_links:read`

**Granular Scopes:** `zoom_events:read:list_access_links`,`zoom_events:read:list_access_links:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
 List of Events Access Links.

access_links.description: The list of event's access links.

name.description: The name of the access link.

type.description:
The type of access link of the event. 
 * `registration` - Attendees will be required to authenticate with the email that was used at registration when joining. 
 * `group-join` - The attendee group specified by the chosen authentication will join without registration.

is_default.description: The default link ensures compatibility with the event links that are used throughout the attendee experience. These existing event links will operate as a registration link or group join link based upon the default setting.. It will be set to false by default.

authentication_method.description:
The event authentication method during registration or during join, depending on the access link type: 
 * `zoom_account` Zoom account holder  * `zoom_account_otp` Sign in with Zoom account or with an email OTP  * `corporate_idp` Sign in to external Single Sign-On (SSO)  * `no_auth` No authentication * `accelerated_auth` Authentication through vanity url

allow_domain_list.description: The registration restricted to these specific domains. This array returns a maximum of 50 domains.

email_restrict_list.description: The registration restricted to users by email addresses. Only these users are allowed to register and these email addresses will receive an email invitation.

email_authentication.description: Attendees will be required to authenticate with the email that was used at registration when joining.

security_code_verification.description: Require additional authentication through a security code.

ticket_type_id.description: Ticket Type ID. This establishes the access permissions of the user within the event.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden Not a host.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `2002`
Event not found.

post.description:
Create an access link for an event.

**Scopes:** `zoom_events_access_links:write`,`zoom_events_access_links:write:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `zoom_events:write:access_links`,`zoom_events:write:access_links:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

type.description:
The type of access link of the event. 
 * `registration` - Attendees will be required to authenticate with the email that was used at registration when joining. 
 * `group-join` - The attendee group specified by the chosen authentication will join without registration.

is_default.description: The default link ensures compatibility with the event links that are used throughout the attendee experience. These existing event links will operate as a registration link or group join link based upon the default setting. It will be set to false by default. Only one link is set to default, at any time.

authentication_method.description:
The event authentication method during registration or during join, depending on the access link type. 
 * `zoom_account` - Zoom account holder.  * `zoom_account_otp` - Sign in with Zoom account or with an email OTP.  * `corporate_idp` - Sign in to external single sign-on (SSO).  * `no_auth` - No authentication. * `accelerate_auth` - Authentication through vanity URL.

allow_domain_list.description: The registration restricted to these specific domains. This array returns a maximum of 50 domains.

email_restrict_list.description: The registration restricted to users by email addresses. Only these users are allowed to register and these email addresses will receive an email invitation.

email_authentication.description: This field applies only to registration link type. Attendees will be required to authenticate with the email that was used at registration when joining.

security_code_verification.description: Require additional authentication through a security code.

security_at_join.description: security at the time of joining.

ticket_type_id.description: The ticket type ID. This field applies only to group-join link type. This establishes the access permissions of the user within the event.

201.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `201`  
 
 Event access link created successfully.

get.description:
Retrieves all events associated with the user.



**Scopes:** `zoom_events_basic:read`,`zoom_events_basic:read:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `zoom_events:read:list_events`,`zoom_events:read:list_events:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: role_type
parameters.description:
The user role type:
* `Host` - All hosted events.
* `Attendee` - All non-hosted ticketed events.

parameters.name: event_status_type
parameters.description:
The type of event status:
* `Upcoming` - All upcoming events.
* `Past` - All past events.
* `Draft` - All events marked as draft.
* `Cancelled` - All cancelled events.

For the `ATTENDEE` role type, only `upcoming` and `past` are valid status types. As a `HOST`, all status types are valid.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned in a single API call. The maximum is 300.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a set of large results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
List of requested events.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

description.example: This event was created with the OpenAPI

event_type.description:
The event types as enum:
 * `CONFERENCE` - Multi session event
 * `SIMPLE_EVENT` - Single session event
 * `RECURRING` - Recurring session event

type.description:
The type of recurring session: 
* `1` â€” Daily. 
* `2` â€” Weekly. 
* `3` â€” Monthly.

repeat_interval.description:
The session's repeat interval: 
* For daily intervals, a max of `90` days. 
* For a weekly interval, a max of `12` weeks. 
* For monthly intervals, a max of `3` months.

weekly_days.description:
A comma-separated list of the days of the week on which the recurring weekly session occurs: 
* `1` â€” Sunday 
* `2` â€” Monday 
* `3` â€” Tuesday 
* `4` â€” Wednesday 
* `5` â€” Thursday 
* `6` â€” Friday 
* `7` â€” Saturday

monthly_days.description: The day of the month on which the recurring monthly session occurs. The value ranges from 1 to 31.

monthly_week_day.description:
The day of the week on which the recurring monthly session is scheduled: 
* `1` â€” Sunday 
* `2` â€” Monday 
* `3` â€” Tuesday 
* `4` â€” Wednesday 
* `5` â€” Thursday 
* `6` â€” Friday 
* `7` â€” Saturday

end_times.description: The number of times the recurring session will occur before it is canceled.

end_date_time.description: The recurring session's final ending date and time before it is canceled, in UTC format.

monthly_week.description:
The week of the month on which a recurring session occurs: 
* `-1` â€” The last week of the month. 
* `1` â€” The first week. 
* `2` â€” The second week. 
* `3` â€” The third week. 
* `4` â€” The fourth week.

access_level.description:
The type of [access level](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/13471207223437-Managing-the-Event-Access-tab): * `PUBLIC` - Public events
* `PRIVATE_UNRESTRICTED` - Private and unrestricted.
* `PRIVATE_RESTRICTED` - Private and restricted.

meeting_type.description:
The type of meeting (for single session and recurring session events): * `MEETING` - Meeting
 * `WEBINAR` - Webinar.

categories.description:
The category of the event.

**Example:**
* Education and Family.
* Business and Networking.
* Entertainment and Visual Arts.
* Food and Drinks.

calendar.description: The start and end time of the calendar invitations in UTC. The format should be `yyyy-MM-dd`T`HH:mm:ssZ

status.description:
The event status: 
Options:
 * `PUBLISHED` - Published event
 * `DRAFT` - Draft event

hub_id.description: The ID of the event hub.

start_time.description: The start time of the event in UTC. The format should be `yyyy-MM-dd`T`HH:mm:ssZ

end_time.description: The end time of the event in UTC. The format should be `yyyy-MM-dd`T`HH:mm:ssZ

contact_name.description: The contact person's name for the event.

contact_email.description: The contact person's email address for the event.

lobby_start_time.description: The start time of the lobby in UTC. The format should be `yyyy-MM-dd`T`HH:mm:ssZ

lobby_end_time.description: The end time of the lobby in UTC. The format should be `yyyy-MM-dd`T`HH:mm:ssZ

items.description: The [country's code](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/abbreviation-lists/#countries).

attendance_type.description:
The type of attendee experience for the event. 
 * `virtual`  virtual attendees only 
 * `in-person` in-person attendees only 
 * `hybrid`  both in-person and virtual attendees

physical_location.description: The physical location of the event. This field is applicable for Hybrid and in-person events only.

get.description:
Retrieves the chat transcripts report for an event.  
 At this present time, this API returns data only for users who enabled [meeting and webinar cloud archiving feature](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061037572-Configuring-archival-settings-for-meetings-and-webinars).  
 Whether users can download in-meeting, private 1:1 and private group chats depends on the meeting and webinar cloud archiving feature.  
 Below chat types data is returned based on the event type and the archiving feature.  
  * `If cloud archiving is enabled`:  
 **For multi-session events** - Lobby Chat, Private Lobby Chat, Event Staff Chat, Exhibitor Chat, Expo Booth Chat, Private 1: 1 Chat, Private Group Chat, In-meeting and webinar Chat .  
  **For single session & recurring events** - In-meeting or webinar chat.  
  * `If cloud archiving is not enabled`  :
 **For multi-session events** - Lobby Chat, Private Lobby Chat, Event Staff Chat, Exhibitor Chat, Expo Booth Chat.  
  **For single session & recurring events** - None.

List all the polls of a session.



**Scopes:** `zoom_events_sessions:read`,`zoom_events_sessions:read:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `zoom_events:read:list_session_polls`,`zoom_events:read:list_session_polls:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
 List of polls returned.

items.title: Session Polling Object

id.description: Session Poll ID. Required for updating an existing poll.

status.description:
Status of the Session Poll:  
 `active` - Poll is active   
 `inactive` - Poll is deactivated

anonymous.description: Allow session participants to answer poll questions anonymously.

poll_type.description:
The type of poll. 
* `1` — Basic Poll. Only single and multiple choice questions are allowed. 
* `2` — Advanced Poll. This feature must be enabled in your Zoom account.  
* `3` — Quiz. This feature must be enabled in your Zoom account.

answer_max_character.description:
The allowed maximum number of characters. This field only applies to `short_answer` and `long_answer` polls. 
* For `short_answer` polls, a maximum of 500 characters. 
* For `long_answer` polls, a maximum of 2,000 characters.

answer_min_character.description: The allowed minimum number of characters. This field only applies to `short_answer` and `long_answer` polls. You must provide at least a **one** character minimum value.

answer_required.description:
Whether participants must answer the question. 
* `true` — The participant must answer the question. 
* `false` — The participant does not need to answer the question. 

**Note:** 
* When the poll's `type` value is `1` (Poll), this value defaults to `true`. 
* When the poll's `type` value is the `2` (Advanced Poll) or `3` (Quiz) values, this value defaults to `false`.

answers.description:
The poll question's available answers. This field requires a **minimum** of two answers. 

* For `single` and `multiple` polls, you can only provide a maximum of 10 answers. 
* For `matching` polls, you can only provide a maximum of 16 answers. 
* For `rank_order` polls, you can only provide a maximum of seven answers.

case_sensitive.description:
Whether the correct answer is case sensitive. This field only applies to `fill_in_the_blank` polls. 
* `true` — The answer is case-sensitive. 
* `false` — The answer is not case-sensitive. 

This value defaults to `false`.

name.description:
The poll question, up to 255 characters. 

For `fill_in_the_blank` polls, this field is the poll's question. For each value that the user must fill in, ensure that there are the same number of `right_answers` values.

prompts.description: Information about the prompt questions. The question prompt's title. This field only applies to `matching` and `rank_order` polls. You **must** provide a minimum of two prompts, up to a maximum of 10 prompts.

prompt_right_answers.description:
The question prompt's correct answers. 
* For `matching` polls, you must provide a minimum of two correct answers, up to a maximum of 10 correct answers. 
* For `rank_order` polls, you can only provide one correct answer.

rating_max_label.description:
The high score label used for the `rating_max_value` field. 

This field only applies to the `rating_scale` poll.

rating_max_value.description:
The rating scale's maximum value, up to a maximum value of 10. 

This field only applies to the `rating_scale` poll.

rating_min_label.description:
The low score label used for the `rating_min_value` field. 

This field only applies to the `rating_scale` poll.

rating_min_value.description:
The rating scale's minimum value. This value cannot be less than zero. 

This field only applies to the `rating_scale` poll.

right_answers.description:
The poll question's correct answer(s). This field is **required** if the poll's `type` value is `3` (Quiz). 

 For `single` and `matching` polls, this field only accepts one answer.

show_as_dropdown.description:
Whether to display the radio selection as a drop-down box. 
* `true` — Show as a drop-down box. 
* `false` — Do not show as a drop-down box. 

This value defaults to `false`.

type.description:
The poll's question and answer type. 
* `single` — Single choice. 
* `multiple` — Multiple choice. 
* `matching` — Matching. 
* `rank_order` — Rank order. 
* `short_answer` — Short answer. 
* `long_answer` — Long answer. 
* `fill_in_the_blank` — Fill in the blank. 
* `rating_scale` — Rating scale.

title.description: The poll's title, up to 64 characters.

items.description: Information about session polling.

get.summary: List registration questions for an event
get.description:
List registration questions and fields that are to be answered by users while registering for an event. These questions are setup during the event level.

**Scopes:** `zoom_events_ticket_types:read`,`zoom_events_ticket_types:read:admin`

**Granular Scopes:** `zoom_events:read:list_registration_questions`,`zoom_events:read:list_registration_questions:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Successfully retrieved registration questions.

questions.description: Array of registration fields whose values should be provided by registrants during registration.

required.description: State whether the selected fields are required or optional.

options.description: An array of answer choices. Can't be used for short or long answer type.

required.description: State whether or not the custom question is required to be answered by a registrant.

question_id.description: The ID of the custom question.

type.description: The question-answer type.

min_length.description:
The minimum length of the custom question answer. This is applicable for short_answer/long_answer question types. 
If this custom question is required then the min_length should be atleast 1.

max_length.description:
The maximum length of the custom question answer. This is applicable for short_answer/long_answer question types. 
The max_length should be greater than or equal min_length. The allowed max_length for short_answer is 500 and for long_answer is 2000.

required.description: Whether the selected fields are required or optional.

name.description: The name of the ticket type.

currency.description: The currency of the ticket type.

price.description: The price of the ticket type.

quantity.description: The quantity of the ticket type.

start_time.description: The start time of ticket sales.

end_time.description: The end time of ticket sales.

description.description: The description of the ticket type.
description.example: The description of the ticket type.

sold_quantity.description: The total number of tickets sold.

sessions.description:
The list of session IDs allowed for this ticket type or *ALL*

account_restrict.description: Whether the ticket type is restricted to certain Zoom accounts.

allow_domain_list.description: The ticket type is restricted to these specific domains. This array returns a maximum of 50 domains.

attendance_type.description:

 * `in-person` in-person attendees only

get.summary: List registration questions for ticket type
get.description:
List registration questions and fields that are to be answered by users while registering for an event. These questions are setup at ticket_type level.

**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Successfully retrieved registration questions.

questions.description: Array of registration fields whose values should be provided by registrants during registration.

required.description: State whether the selected fields are required or optional.

options.description: An array of answer choices. Can't be used for short or long answer type.

required.description: State whether or not the custom question is required to be answered by a registrant.

question_id.description: The ID of the custom question.

type.description: The question-answer type.

min_length.description:
The minimum length of the custom question answer. This is applicable for short_answer/long_answer question types. 
If this custom question is required then the min_length should be atleast 1.

max_length.description:
The maximum length of the custom question answer. This is applicable for short_answer/long_answer question types. 
The max_length should be greater than or equal min_length. The allowed max_length for short_answer is 500 and for long_answer is 2000.

 Also, if **true** then event_registration_link is returned instead of event_join_link in the response.
